parse

public static String[] parse(String toParse,
                             String delimiter,
                             boolean parseByCharacter,
                             boolean ignoreEmptyElements)
Utility for splitting a given text into a String array. The string is cut whenever the given delimiter is found. There are different modes how the delimiter is used. The first mode (parseByCharacter = true) is using each character of the given delimiter to cut the given text. The second mode (parseByCharacter = false) is using the given delimiter as whole to cut the given text. Additionally there is the option to ignore empty elements in the given text. An empty element means that two occurrances of a delimiter are following each other without something else in between. Depending on the value of ignoreEmptyElements there is a entry (an empty String) in the returned String array or not. That is, the length of the array will be different.
Special conditions:
  • If toParse starts with delim then the first element in the array is an empty string.
  • If toParse ends with delimiter then the last element in the array is an empty string.

Parameters:
toParse - The text that has to be parsed.
delimiter - The delimiter(s) that have to be used.
parseByCharacter - The delimiter will be handled as one single delimiter (=true) or as a set of delimiter cahracters(=false) .
ignoreEmptyElements - An empty String is generated if two delimiters are following each other (=false) or not (=true).
Returns:
the elements of the given text as an array.
Special cases:
  • If toParse is null a String array with one element is returned. This element is null.
  • If toParse is empty a String array is returned with one element whose value is toParse.
  • If delimiter is null a String array is returned with one element whose value is toParse.

expandTabs

public static String expandTabs(String toExpand,
                                int tabsize)
General-purpose utility function to replace the tabs inside a string according a given TAB Size with blanks. This is usefull for listings using monospaced fonts.

Example

 
 String toParse="\t\tpart1\tpart2"; (length:13)
 is converted into:
         part1   part2
 123456789012345678901
The first two tabs are expanded to 8 blanks, the TAB between the tokens is expanded to three blanks setting the start of part2 after position 16. It must be noted, that a StringTokenizer would detect only two tokens!

Parameters:
toExpand - The string to process
tabsize - The spacing of the individual tabs. If < 0 then 0 is used.
Returns:
The processed string without tabs, but blanks.

chain

public static String chain(String[] fields,
                           char delim)
Concat the fields of a String array with delim.

Parameters:
fields - String array
delim - Delimiter-char.
Returns:
Concatuation like ",,..." if delim was ','. If the given array is null or it it contains no values (length=0) this method returns 'null'.

Returns:
the processed argument.

verboseStringCompare

public static String verboseStringCompare(String s1,
                                          String s2,
                                          int outputLength)
Compares two strings. The output is useful for debug and test purposes.

Parameters:
s1 - A string.
s2 - Another string
outputLength - The number of chars before and after the index where the two strings differ that gets copied to result string of this method.
Returns:
An empty string if s1 and s2 are null or both contain the same string of characters. If s1 or s2 is null the text "s1 was 'null'" resp. "s2 was 'null'". If s1 and s2 are not null and different, the result string contains the position of the first difference and outputLength characters before and after that position.

replaceFirst

public static String replaceFirst(String srcStr,
                                  String oldStr,
                                  String newStr)
Replaces the first occurence of oldStr in srcStr with newStr.

Parameters:
srcStr - A string. If 'null' null is returned.
oldStr - The string to search for in srcStr. If 'null' or empty the given 'srcStr' is returned.
newStr - The new string. If 'null' or empty the given 'oldStr' is removed.
Returns:
A new string with the first occurence of oldStr replaced with newStr.

replaceAll

public static String replaceAll(String srcStr,
                                String oldStr,
                                String newStr)
Replaces all occurences of oldStr in srcStr with newStr.

Parameters:
srcStr - A string. If 'null' null is returned.
oldStr - The string to search for in srcStr. If 'null' or empty the given 'srcStr' is returned.
newStr - The new string. If 'null' or empty the given 'oldStr' is removed.
Returns:
A new string with all occurences of oldStr replaced with newStr.
See Also:
since jdk1.4.

replaceWord

public static String replaceWord(String src,
                                 String find,
                                 String replace)
Replaces all occurences of a word within a String by another word. A word is defined as a String that is separated from other Strings by one of the following " \t\n\r\f":
  • - the space character,
  • - the TAB character, the newline character, the carriage-return character,
  • - the form-feed character.

Parameters:
src - A String. If 'null' null is returned.
find - The word to replace. If 'null' or empty the given 'src' is returned.
replace - The replacement. If 'null' or empty the given 'find' is removed.
Returns:
A new String where all occurences of the word 'find' are replaced by the word 'replace'

appendHashtableToBuffer

public static void appendHashtableToBuffer(StringBuffer toBuffer,
                                           Hashtable fromHashtable,
                                           String keyValueSeparator,
                                           String entrySeparator)
Append all key value pairs of the given Hashtable (can also be a Properties object) to the given StringBuffer. If the StringBuffer or the Hashtable is 'null' this method does nothing. If one of the separators is 'null' it is converted to an empty text.

Parameters:
toBuffer - The StringBuffer to append to.
fromHashtable - The Hashtable to read from.
keyValueSeparator - The separator between key and value. (e.g. '=')
entrySeparator - The separator between two key-value pairs. (e.g. '\n')
